byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Badana Pichwk, and Tim Arango from Erbil, Iraq. Matthew Rosenberg contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and TIM ARANGO

abstract: Kurdish forces begin moving on Iraqi villages east of Mosul, start of long-anticipated battle to reclaim city from Islamic State; concerns linger over city's large civilian population.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: About 4,000 pesh merga forces are involved in the operation to retake 10 Iraqi villages, the opening phase of a battle that could take weeks or months.
snippet: About 4,000 pesh merga forces are involved in the operation to retake 10 Iraqi villages, the opening phase of a battle that could take weeks or months....

headline.main: East of Mosul, Kurdish Troops Advance on ISIS-Held Villages
headline.print_headline: Battle’s First Phase Starts as Kurdish Troops Advance on Villages Near Mosul
